au_1034267: xxd -r -p -o OFFSET <(echo NEW HEX SIGNATURE) FILE  # or
echo NEW HEX SIGNATURE | xxd -r -p -o OFFSET - FILE

$ file 01.png 
01.png: PNG image data, 1280 x 1024, 8-bit/color RGB, non-interlaced
$ xxd 01.png | head -1
00000000: 8950 4e47 0d0a 1a0a 0000 000d 4948 4452  .PNG........IHDR
$ xxd -r -p -o 0 <(echo 5261 7221 1A07 0000) 01.png
$ file 01.png 
01.png: RAR archive data, vdb, os: MS-DOS
$ xxd 01.png | head -1
00000000: 5261 7221 1a07 0000 0000 000d 4948 4452  Rar!........IHDR

dd conv=notrunc obs=1 if=<(xxd -r -p -o 0 <(echo 5261 7221 1A07 0000)) of=01.png

so_29930588: for FILE in "$@"; do
    if [ -e "$DIRECTORY/$FILE" ]; then
        echo "$FILE already exists"
    else
        cp "$FILE" $DIRECTORY
    fi
done
so_15510716: echo "Here is my new first line" && sed '1d' asd.txt

Top-3 Scripts:
so_16665157: find . -exec grep -il -E 'Programmer.*Bob' {} \; \
    | xargs sed -i '1,10 s/.*Programmer.*Bob.*/LINE REPLACED/'

ul_583230: find . -iname "*.tmt" | xargs dirname | uniq | xargs -I{} sh -c "cp -u {}*.tmt /destination/path && java command.jar"

xargs dirname

xargs -I{} sh -c "cp -u {}*.tmt /destination/path && java command.jar"

find . -iname "*.tmt" | xargs -I{} sh -c "cp -u {} /destination/path && java command.jar"

Explanations about Options.-I:
Replace occurrences of replace-str in the initial-arguments with names read from
 standard input. Also, unquoted blanks do not terminate input items; instead the
 separator is the newline character. Implies -x and -L 1.
